description: The module provides a structured programme for students who wish to understand and acquire skills relevant to the practice of public international law in a government setting. The module is organised around three key milestones: first, four 'crash course' lecture-style teaching hours grouped at the beginning of the semester to equip students with foundational legal concepts concerning United Nations law-making, including the International Law Commission; second, a mid-semester oral presentation with practitioners; and third, preparations in Singapore for the annual fall sessions of the Sixth Committee of the UN General Assembly.
title: Singapore at the UN - A Clinical Externship
